intro: Willdenowia tristachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willdenowia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and showy, pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Willdenowia tristachya is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
